titleStmt.title: Here be .vij. dialogues The fyrst is of the so[n]ne and of the moone. The seconde of Saturne, and of the clowde. The .iii. of the sterre named Transmontana, and other sterres. The .iiij. of the euyn sterre and the morowe sterre. The .v. of the raynebowe, and the sygne Cancer. The .vi. of heauen, and of earth. The .vij of the eyre, and of the wynde. By these dialogues, a man maye take to hym selfe good counsayle.
Dialogus creaturarum optimé moralizatus. Dialogues 1-7. English.
titleStmt.author: Nicolaus, Pergaminus, attributed name.
Mayno, de' Mayneri, d. 1368, attributed name.

titleStmt.title: Here be .vij. dialogues The fyrst is of the so[n]ne and of the moone. The seconde of Saturne, and of the clowde. The .iii. of the sterre named Transmontana, and other sterres. The .iiij. of the euyn sterre and the morowe sterre. The .v. of the raynebowe, and the sygne Cancer. The .vi. of heauen, and of earth. The .vij of the eyre, and of the wynde. By these dialogues, a man maye take to hym selfe good counsayle.
Dialogus creaturarum optimé moralizatus. Dialogues 1-7. English.
titleStmt.author: Nicolaus, Pergaminus, attributed name.
Mayno, de' Mayneri, d. 1368, attributed name.

publicationStmt.publisher: Imprynted by me Robert wyer, dwellynge in seynt Martyns parysshe. Ad imprimendum solum,

notesStmt.note: A translation of dialogues 1-7 of "Dialogus creaturarum optimé moralizatus", variously attributed to Nicolaus Pergaminus and to Mayno de' Mayneri.
Imprint from colophon; conjectured publication date from STC.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
